caption.center: DOUGLAS WAGNER, JR. v. MARY WAGNER.

court.center: Connecticut Superior Court, Judicial District of Waterbury

opinion_text.unpublished:
The court, after hearing the parties and reviewing all the evidence, finds that residence requirements have been satisfied and the Wife has been the recipient of public assistance. All pertinent criteria outlined in Chapter 815j of the General Statutes were considered by the court in the entry of the following orders.
ORDERS DISSOLUTION OF MARRIAGE The marriage is dissolved on the grounds of irretrievable breakdown.
CUSTODY AND VISITATION The parties shall have joint legal custody of the minor child.
1. For school purposes, the Husband shall have primary physical residence.
2. The Wife shall have parenting time every Thursday from after day-care or 3:00 p.m. or after her workday, whichever is most convenient, until Friday morning at which time she shall take the child to day-care or school as the case may be.
3. The Wife shall also have parenting time on alternating weekends from her Thursday afternoon pickup until Monday morning when she shall take the child to day-care or school as the case may be.
4. Each party shall have three non-consecutive weeks vacation time during the summer. They shall each notify the other by May 15 of each year of the weeks intended with the Wife having the first choice in odd-numbered years and the Husband in even. That is, the Wife shall choose her first week, the Husband the second week, and the Wife the CT Page 7547-bi third. The last week before school begins shall always belong to the Husband unless the parties agree otherwise.
5. The parties shall alternate holidays.
6. Holiday and vacation time shall supersede the regular parenting schedule.
7. The Wife's overnight parenting time is conditioned upon her providing suitable sleeping accommodations for the child as certified by the Guardian Ad Litem.
8. Neither parent shall permanently remove the minor child from the State of Connecticut without prior written consent of the other parent or a court order.
9. Neither parent shall enroll the minor child in any activity which occurs during the other parent's regularly scheduled access without prior consent of the other parent.
10. Neither parent shall make disparaging remarks concerning the other parent in any circumstance in which the minor child may overhear such remarks and the parents shall use all reasonable efforts to insure that third parties make no disparaging remarks about the other parent when the minor child is in a circumstance in which the minor child could reasonably overhear such remarks.
11. Transportation to any activity in which the child participates shall be the responsibility of the parent having custody and control of the child at the time of the scheduled activity.
12. Each party shall have full access to the medical and school records of the child.
13. Each party shall have reasonable telephone contact with the child when she is with the other party.
ALIMONY No alimony is awarded to either party.
CHILD SUPPORT Until such time as the Wife is gainfully employed, the Husband shall pay to her child support in the amount of $75.00 per week, as well as all CT Page 7547-bj day-care expenses. The Wife shall notify the Husband within 48 hours of obtaining employment including her salary.
Each party reserves the right to seek an educational support order pursuant to statute.
LIFE INSURANCE Each party shall name the minor child beneficiary on any life insurance available to them from their respective places of employment.
MEDICAL INSURANCE The Husband shall maintain the medical insurance he now has in force for the benefit of the minor child. All unreimbursed expenses shall be shared 76% by the Husband and 24% by the Wife. This paragraph shall be subject to modification upon the Wife's obtaining employment.
PERSONAL PROPERTY Each party shall retain the personal property, bank accounts, retirement assets, and motor vehicles in their respective names and control without claim from the other.
LIABILITIES Each party shall be responsible for their own liabilities.
COUNSEL FEES Each party shall be responsible for their own counsel fees. The fees for the Guardian Ad Litem shall be equally shared.
TAXES The Husband shall be entitled to the dependency exemption for the minor child. This paragraph shall be subject to modification.
By April 15 of each year, until there is no longer any financial obligation for child support, the parties shall exchange their complete IRS returns in order to determine that the payments are appropriate under the circumstances then existing.
MISCELLANEOUS CT Page 7547-bk Each party shall sign any necessary documents to effectuate the orders contained herein.
Plaintiff's counsel shall prepare the judgment file, have it certified by defendant's counsel, and file it with the court within 30 days.
The State of Connecticut shall have the right to reopen this judgment in order to seek an order concerning reimbursement for public assistance.
CUTSUMPAS, J. CT Page 7547-bl
